page.title: 02FAMILY LIFE IN GULLANE
page.content: Most fathers or mothers in the family go to work in Edinburgh.They go by the family car,the company car or train. Some others go to work in Gullane or neighbouring villages and towns. One hundred and sixty children attend the local primary school.When they leave primary school the majority of them go to North Berwick High School. Children travelling to the primary school usually walk because Gullane is a small place.The children amuse themselves with sports, clubs and occasionally discos. Many families own a dog and enjoy taking it for a walk.It is popular because there is a lot of open space, including the beach and the golf course.In the evenings most families watch television or go to clubs.The popular clubs are swimming,tennis, bowling and golf.
